title: Panel, 18th–19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: embroidered in bukhara couching stitches on plain weave
creditline: Gift of Provident Securities Company from the Estate of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Crocker
description: On a loosely woven red tabby ground, blue, pale green, white and buff silks in bukhara couching stitch form an all-over diagonal trellis pattern enclosing large diamond forms with leaf outlines in whose centers are reserved small squares. White discs connect the arms of the trellis.

participants.person_name: Estate of Mr. & Mrs. William H. Crocker

tombstone.epitaph:
Panel, 18th–19th century.Medium: silk
Technique: embroidered in bukhara couching stitches on plain weave. Gift of Provident Securities Company from the Estate of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Crocker. 1955-133-14.
